document_title: Chronic cystitis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
First, patients with chronic cystitis will be advised to change their urination and drinking habits, along with a diet that reduces sweets, fats, and stimulants. Warming the bladder is also an option.
Antimuscarinic drugs are drugs prescribed to reduce bladder muscle contractions. The doctor will inject this medicine into the patient's bladder to help strengthen the lining's protective properties.
To support the treatment of chronic cystitis with medication, doctors will also prescribe patients to perform physical therapy as one of the main treatment activities.
Some ways to treat chronic cystitis besides using antibiotics include:
Change to a healthy, nutritious diet; Limit dehydration of the body; Bladder training to control the need and frequency of urination; Understand the outbreak times of the disease to have appropriate intervention; Limit caffeine use to avoid increasing the intensity of pain
drink a lot of water
